Darrell Long.content: Give a bullet point biography of Darrell Long highlighting their contributions and achievements as a computer scientist, with each fact separated with a new line character.

J\u00fcrg Gutknecht.content: Give a bullet point biography of Jürg Gutknecht highlighting their contributions and achievements as a computer scientist, with each fact separated with a new line character.

- Swiss computer scientist and longtime researcher and lecturer at ETH Zurich  
- Close collaborator of Niklaus Wirth on language and systems research  
- Co-designer of the Oberon programming language family and the Oberon operating system  
- Co-author (with Niklaus Wirth) of the influential Project Oberon book and system documentation  
- Architect and implementer of Oberon compilers, tools and integrated development environments  
- Pioneered minimalist, practical system and language design emphasizing simplicity, readability and efficiency  
- Worked on component-based and modular software design, promoting clear interfaces and composition techniques  
- Led projects that moved research prototypes into working systems and hardware demonstrations  
- Contributed substantially to education in programming languages, compilers and systems through teaching and supervision  
- Helped disseminate Oberon ideas through papers, implementations and collaborations with industry and academic groups

Here are some bullet point biographies of Jürg Gutknecht given by other agents: 

 Agent response: ```- Swiss computer scientist and long-time collaborator of Niklaus Wirth
- Member of the Programming Systems Group at ETH Zurich, contributing to research and teaching in systems and language design
- Co-designer and implementer of the Lilith workstation and its system software (a research RISC-like workstation developed for Modula-2)
- Major contributor to the design and implementation of the Oberon programming language family and the Oberon operating environment
- Co-author (with Niklaus Wirth) of the book Project Oberon, documenting the Oberon system, compiler and a compact hardware implementation
- Worked extensively on compiler construction, language implementation, and minimal, efficient system software
- Developed integrated programming tools and runtimes emphasizing simplicity, clarity and practical engineering
- Supervised and influenced generations of students and researchers in programming systems and language design
- Helped demonstrate practical principles of modularity, extensibility and lean system architecture in both software and hardware projects
- Left a lasting impact on software engineering and programming-language research through the Oberon projects and related implementations```

 Agent response: ```- Swiss computer scientist and long-time faculty member at ETH Zurich, later professor emeritus  
- Close collaborator of Niklaus Wirth on language and systems research  
- Co-designer of the Lilith personal workstation, a research workstation developed at ETH in the early 1980s  
- Co-developer of the Oberon programming language and the Oberon operating system / Oberon System, exploring minimalist language–OS integration  
- Contributor to compiler construction, system software, programming-language design and implementation  
- Developed practical, compact system implementations used for teaching and research at ETH  
- Co-author of influential technical papers and reports documenting Lilith, Oberon and their implementations  
- Mentor and supervisor to generations of students and researchers in systems and language design  
- Advocated simplicity and clean engineering in system and language design, influencing later research on language-based systems  
- Recognized within the Swiss and academic computer-science communities for his contributions to education, system design and software engineering```

 Closely examine your biography and the biography of other agents and provide an updated bullet point biography.

- Swiss computer scientist and long-time faculty member of the Programming Systems Group at ETH Zurich, later professor emeritus  
- Close collaborator of Niklaus Wirth on programming-language and systems research  
- Co-designer and implementer of the Lilith personal workstation and its system software (a research RISC-like workstation developed at ETH, originally used with Modula-2)  
- Co-designer and principal implementer of the Oberon programming language family and the Oberon operating environment (Oberon System)  
- Co-author (with Niklaus Wirth) of the book Project Oberon, documenting the Oberon system, its compiler, tools and a compact hardware implementation  
- Architect and implementer of Oberon compilers, runtime systems, integrated development tools and minimal IDEs used for teaching and research  
- Led hardware–software integration work, including compact hardware demonstrations and FPGA-based implementations associated with Project Oberon  
- Pioneered minimalist, pragmatic system and language design emphasizing simplicity, clarity, efficiency and tight language–OS integration  
- Worked extensively on compiler construction, language implementation techniques and system software engineering  
- Advanced ideas in modularity, component-based design and clean interface discipline in both languages and systems  
- Contributed numerous technical papers, reports and system distributions that made research prototypes into usable teaching and research platforms  
- Mentor and supervisor to generations of students and researchers in programming systems, compilers and language design  
- Helped disseminate Oberon principles broadly in academia and industry, leaving a lasting influence on software engineering and programming-language research

- Swiss computer scientist and long-time member of the Programming Systems Group at ETH Zurich
